You are here:

SALESFORCE HELP
DOCS
VISUALFORCE B2B COMMERCE
Set Up Data for the Product Compare Page

If you've created a storefront using the minimum storefront data or the Capricorn Coffee demo, the Product Compare page isn't enabled by default. To get started with the Product Compare page, update your storefront configuration settings and select which specs a buyer can compare.

REQUIRED EDITIONS AND USER PERMISSIONS

Salesforce Compatibility

Salesforce Classic (not available in all orgs) and Lightning Experience for Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, and Developer editions.




B2B Commerce Compatibility

B2B Commerce for Visualforce Winter ’21 (version 4.13)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Spring ’20 (version 4.12)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Summer ’19 (version 4.11)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Spring ’19 (version 4.10)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Summer ’18 (version 4.9)


USER PERMISSIONS NEEDED
To access CC Admin and change settings:	Access B2B Commerce for Visualforce Admin Settings permission set
To view page layouts:	View Setup and Configuration
To customize page layouts:	Customize Application
To modify spec definitions:	Edit on CC Specs
To execute anonymous Apex:	Author Apex
Update the appropriate storefront configuration setting.
On the CC Admin tab in your org, select your storefront (1).
In the Storefront Settings menu, select Configuration Settings (2).
From the Module picklist, select Product Comare (3).
Find the Enabled configuration (4), and make sure that its value is TRUE (5).
TIP
If the value is FALSE, click Override in the Action column. Enter TRUE for Value, and click Create.
If the configuration doesn't exist, click New , enter the following values in the New Page Setting window, and click Create.
FIELD	VALUE
Module	Product Compare
Configuration	Enabled
Page	all
Value	TRUE
Build and activate a new configuration cache.
Show the Is Comparable field in the page layout for the CC Spec custom object.
NOTE When you enable the Is Comparable field on a spec, the Product Compare page shows differences in values for the spec across the compared products.
Find the page layouts for the CC Spec custom object.
In Lightning Experience, click the Object Manager tab in Setup. Select CC Spec, and then scroll to the Page Layouts section.
In Salesforce Classic, enter Object in the Quick Find box in Setup, and then select Objects. Select CC Spec and scroll to Page Layouts.
Click CC Spec Layout.
From Fields, drag IsComparable to the CC Spec Detail section in the page layout:
Save your changes.
Enable the Is Comparable field on the spec records that you want to allow buyers to compare.
On the CC Specs tab in your org, select a spec, and click Edit.
Enable Is Comparable, and click Save.
Repeat these steps for each spec that you want to allow buyers to compare.
TIP To enable this field on all specs in your org, execute the following anonymous Apex code from the Developer Console:
List<ccrz__E_Spec__c> specs = [SELECT ccrz__IsComparable__c FROM ccrz__E_Spec__c ];

for(ccrz__E_Spec__c spec : specs){
    spec.ccrz__IsComparable__c = TRUE;
}

update specs;
Refresh the product spec index.

After you enable the Product Compare page, a Compare button becomes available for each standard product on the Product List page.

NOTE The Compare button isn't available for other product types, such as a bundle, kit, or aggregated product.

Clicking Compare (1) opens a window (2) and adds the product (3) to the lists the products that the buyer wants to compare. The window provides controls for removing a product (4) or all products (5) from the comparison. The buyer can also collapse the window (6) and continue browsing the Product List page, or click Compare Products (7) to launch the Product Compare page.

On the Product Compare page, the comparable specs appear in a table, where specs with different values among the selected products are highlighted.
